name: sweetening, natural gas | sweetening, natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29267/documentation

Data is based on the environmental report of the plant of Grossenkneten.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Sweetening of sour gas with average 10 Vol.-% of H2S. The data refers to 1 m3 output gas
category: B:Mining and quarrying/06:Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas/062:Extraction of natural gas/0620:Extraction of natural gas

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Average of 5 last years is used (1996-2000). Emissions per m3 were stable.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The figures are based on the German data (sweetening plant Grossenkneten).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data is taken out the BEB environmental report 2000. The plant in Grossenkneten is operational since 1972 and is according to BEB one of the biggest and environmental friendliest of the world. It eliminates sulphur compounds to 99.99% from gas. The connected sulphur extraction plant has an extraction rate of 99.8%. The production in Grossenkneten is 4.8 Mrd. m3 gas per year. Sour gas with less as 1% H2S (lean gas) is treated with the Purisol process (physically), sour gas with more sulphur is treated chemically. The solutions used for the gas scrubbing are regenerated and warmed up to 130 °C. By this process a gas mix of H2S and CO2 is released. Subsequently H2S is transformed in elementary sulphur and water in a thermal process by 1'000-2'000°C and in a three-stage catalytic part.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data for Germany are extrapolated out of the data for the sweetening plant Grossenkneten. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography DE. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is based on environmental report. No information about the sampling procedure.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=DE
Scaled to LHV of ecoinvent v3 based on the German LHV for NG.

Paul Scherrer Institut&Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Villigen& Dübendorf, CH.); volume of sour gas arriving at plant is approximately 1.25 times the volume of treated output gas.
